TicTac4

Class BoardPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • TicTac4.BoardPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    class BoardPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class holds the code needed to create each Connect-4 game. The panel is split into a specified number of rows and columns (usually 6x7) into a grid. Each grid cell holds a Piece object, for which colors are changed when Connect-4 pieces are placed. This class is responsible for keeping track of each Piece object's position, and to report to the JFrame class if the game has been won. There are methods to freeze the game board, to display the winner, and to show various styling.

      • BoardPanel

        public BoardPanel(int rows,
                  int columns,
                  int width,
                  int height,
                  BigBoard bigBoard)
        Constructor that sets up each Connect-4 game. Initializes variables and styles, then runs.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows for the game (usually 6)
        columns - The number of columns for the game (usually 7)
        width - The width of the JPanel
        height - The height of the JPanel
        bigBoard - The main JFrame parent

    • Method Detail

      • hasWon

        private boolean hasWon(int pieceRow,
                       int pieceColumn)
        This function determines if anyone has won the game. It goes through each possible winning combination and checks if the colors match for a given Piece's location. This function was borrowed from: https://github.com/axelronquist/connectfour/blob/5827f2b45bcdf6a7662b56b99d9510748f89c8df/src/connectfour/Board.java
        Parameters:
        pieceRow - The Piece's row
        pieceColumn - The Piece's column
        Returns:
        True if the game has been won, false otherwise

      • isBoardFull

        private java.lang.Boolean isBoardFull()
        This function is used to determine if the Connect-4 game board is full of pieces, no empty spots
        Returns:
        True if full, false otherwise

      • set

        private void set()
        This fills the game board with empty pieces - technically they're not empty, just white

      • setHighlightBorder

        public void setHighlightBorder(Piece hoveredPiece)
        Used to show the column highlighting border for each Connect-4 game, shows a small rectangle with the current turn's color above the hovered column
        Parameters:
        hoveredPiece - The piece that is currently being hovered.

      • setDefaultBorder

        public void setDefaultBorder(Piece unhoveredPiece)
        Used to remove the highlighted rectangle when not hovering over the column any longer.
        Parameters:
        unhoveredPiece - The piece to remove the highlighted rectangle from

      • findPiece

        private int[] findPiece(Piece p)
        This function is used to find the matrix indexes of a given Piece object
        Parameters:
        p - The Piece object to search for
        Returns:
        An array of integers, holding row and column, of a piece if found. Null otherwise.

      • addPiece

        public void addPiece(int column)
        Called when a piece is to be added to the board. If it can be filled, do as so and switch the turns. Also checks if the Connect-4 game has a winner after each added piece.
        Parameters:
        column - The column for a piece to be "dropped" in.

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(java.lang.Boolean b)
        Changes the editing boolean for the Connect-4 game
        Parameters:
        b - True or false, whether the board can be edited or not

      • switchTurn

        private void switchTurn()
        Every time a piece is added, the turn needs to be changed. This function does as so.

      • winner

        private void winner()
        When the game has been won, or tied, reset all pieces and display the Tic-Tac-Toe symbol with the same color. If the game was tied, display a sad face ):

      • resetAll

        private void resetAll()
        Resets all pieces on the game board to white, just like the start.
